intro: Eleocharis guaglianoniana, commonly known as the Guaglianona sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to certain regions of South America, particularly Argentina and Brazil, where it thrives in wetland and marshy environments. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, spike-like inflorescences that produce tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It plays a role in maintaining wetland ecosystems by stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in some areas.
